publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3332 George Foulkes: Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival—That the Parliament notes with concern the reports that the Edinburgh International Festival programme for 2009 contains no reference to the life, work or influence of Robert Burns and considers it a matter of great regret that a Scottish poet whose works have influenced people the world over and are especially relevant today should be so ignored by Scotland and the world’s leading arts festival in this, the 250th anniversary year of his birth. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-3332 George Foulkes: Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival—That the Parliament notes with concern the reports that the Edinburgh International Festival programme for 2009 contains no reference to the life, work or influence of Robert Burns and considers it a matter of great regret that a Scottish poet whose works have influenced people the world over and are especially relevant today should be so ignored by Scotland and the world’s leading arts festival in this, the 250th anniversary year of his birth. Supported by: Ian McKee*, Cathy Peattie*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Kenneth Gibson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Trish Godman*, Margaret Curran*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3332 Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival (lodged on 29 January 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3332 Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival (lodged on 29 January 2009) Mike Pringle*, Karen Gillon*, John Park*, Elaine Murray* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-3332 Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival (lodged on 29 January 2009) Willie Coffey* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-3332 Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival (lodged on 29 January 2009) Jamie McGrigor* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-3332 Robert Burns and the Edinburgh International Festival (lodged on 29 January 2009) Margo MacDonald* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
